intro: Chaerophyllum friedrichsstahlii, commonly known as the Friedrichs' cow parsley, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to theApiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that attract pollinators like bees and flies. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
